original: Centerwall, Bror August, redaktör, Göteborg, f. 5/3/91 i Kristianstad av trädg:mäst. Lorentz C. o. Hanna Tufvesson. G. 26 m. Marta Bock. Barn: Stefan f. 34. — Teat:stud. f. Konst. Axelsson 09-11. Skådesp. h. Aug. Falck m. fl. 11-15, sekr. h. Lorensbergsteatern i Gbg 22-23, tidn :korresp. i London, Paris, Rom o. New York t. Gbgs Hand:- o. Sjöfartstidn. m. fl. 18-22 o. 23-38, Gbgs Hand:- o. Sjöfartstidn. uts. korresp. t. Amerika o. Västindien 29-30, Morgontidn. i Gbg korresp. i Paris 32-38, i Gbgs Hand:-o. Sjöfartstidn. red. sed. 38, dess korresp. v. Expo i New York 39. Sign.: Picon. Ordf. i Skand. fören. i Rom 25-26. Skr.: Thespiskärran (14), Budda o. parasiten (22), Parisluft (23), Figurer i staden (28), Konsten att resa (32). RFrHL, Dansk FrM.
translated: Centerwall, Bror August, editor, Gothenburg, born March 5, 1891 in Kristianstad to horticulturist Lorentz C. and Hanna Tufvesson. Married Marta Bock in 1926, with a son named Stefan (born 1934). Studied theater with Konst. Axelsson from 1909 to 1911. Acted in theater with August Falck and others from 1911 to 1915, served as secretary of the Lorensberg Theater in Gothenburg from 1922 to 1923, and worked as a correspondent in London, Paris, Rome, and New York for several newspapers from 1918 to 1938, including Gothenburg's Handel and Sjöfartstidn. Sent as a correspondent to America and the West Indies in 1929 to 1930, and to Paris for Morgontidn. in Gothenburg from 1932 to 1938. Became editor of Gothenburg's Handel and Sjöfartstidn. in 1938, and served as their correspondent at Expo in New York in 1939. Also served as the president of the Scandinavian Society in Rome from 1925 to 1926. Wrote Thespiskärran (14), Budda and parasiten (22), Parisluft (23), Figurer i staden (28), and Konsten att resa (32). Awarded the Royal Order of the Polar Star (RFrHL) and the Danish Order of the Dannebrog (Dansk FrM).

awards.name: Royal Order of the Polar Star
